title: Fatal crash closes I-70 in Maryland in both directions
text:
Just before 7 a.m., there was a report of a six-mile backup headed east on the highway.

#BREAKING UPDATE: One lane of traffic on the EB shoulder and the inside WB shoulder of I-70 now moving past fatal crash scene. Driver of sedan that caught fire after it collided with a tanker truck on EB I-70 west of Exit 62/Rt. 75 died at scene. @Wusa9traffic #GetUpDC #MDTraffic pic.twitter.com/fI0vxutdYS — WUSA9 (@wusa9) October 24, 2019

Maryland State Police said the crash involved a “tanker semi-trailer truck” and a car, possibly a Honda Civic. When troopers arrived, the car was “fully engulfed in flames,” and the driver was found dead inside the car.

The driver of the truck was taken to an area hospital.

UPDATE: ONE EB LANE AND ONE WB LANE now getting by the fatal crash on I-70 in New Market. Horrible scene. Miles of delays. @nbcwashington pic.twitter.com/zcr7GYW2hY — First4Traffic (@First4Traffic) October 24, 2019

The crash remains under investigation, and drivers on the highway will face delays for “an extended period,” officials said. One lane in each direction was getting by around 7 a.m.

Traffic is being diverted to MD 144.

AD
description: A tractor-trailer crashed into a car, and the highway in Maryland is closed.
